meanings.sent1: The foxes ran through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of foxes playing in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The foxes were so sneaky, they stole all the cookies from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her bright red hair stood out in the crowd like a group of foxes in a snowy field.
meanings.sent5: The cunning foxes outsmarted the hunter and escaped into the night.

meanings.definition: Foxes: third person singular present of fox
meanings.sent1: He foxes around the yard every morning.
meanings.sent2: She foxes quickly through the pages of her book.
meanings.sent3: The cat watches as the dog foxes around the room, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Time foxes away when you're having fun, just like a sly fox slipping through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The wind foxes through the leaves, creating a soothing sound in the forest.

meanings.definition: Foxes: to trick or deceive someone
meanings.sent1: She foxes her little brother into believing he has superpowers.
meanings.sent2: The con artist foxes unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The magician foxes the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: His charming smile can fox even the most skeptical person.
meanings.sent5: The tricky foxes in the fairy tale always find a way to outwit their enemies.
